original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/2/2019:

_Away from me, all you who do evil, for the_

_Lord has heard my weeping._ (Ps. 6:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it?

Oh yes life can seem unbearable at time.But don't let

circumstances keep you down. Meditate on God's

goodness to you, and talk to Him. Knowing that He

loves and "accepts [your] prayer" (Ps. 6:9), will give

you strength to help you get up when your down.

When things are looking down, try looking up!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it? Oh yes life can seem unbearable at time. But don't let circumstances keep you down. Meditate on God's goodness to you, and talk to Him. Knowing that He loves and "accepts [your] prayer" (Psalm 6:9), will give you strength to help you get up when your down. When things are looking down, try looking up!
original_verse_text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our moments of despair, when the weight of the world seems too heavy to bear. Yet, we are reminded that You hear our cries and accept our prayers, even when we feel overwhelmed. Strengthen us, Lord, to look to You for comfort and guidance, for You are the source of our hope and the One who lifts us up when we are down. May we find solace in Your unfailing love and the knowledge that You are always near. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it? Oh yes, life can seem unbearable at times. But don't let circumstances keep you down. Meditate on God's goodness to you, and talk to Him. Knowing that He loves and "accepts [your] prayer" (Psalm 6:9) will give you strength to help you get up when you're down. When things are looking down, try looking up!
subject: Strength in God's Acceptance
verse_text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/3/2019:

_What is a man that You are mindful of Him,_

_and the son of man that You visit him? _(Ps. 8:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To respect God's greatness, we must compare

ourselves to a speck of dust to God's greatness.

When we look at creation, we often feel small

by comparison. To feel small is a healthy way

to get back to reality, BUT God does not want

us to dwell on our smallness

HUMILITY MEANS PROPER RESPECT FOR GOD.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: To respect God's greatness, we must compare ourselves to a speck of dust to God's greatness. When we look at creation, we often feel small by comparison. To feel small is a healthy way to get back to reality, BUT God does not want us to dwell on our smallness HUMILITY MEANS PROPER RESPECT FOR GOD.
original_verse_text: What is a man that You are mindful of Him, and the son of man that You visit him?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your majesty and power, for You have fearfully and wonderfully made us. When we consider the vastness of Your creation, we are humbled by our own insignificance. Yet, You have deemed us worthy of Your love and attention, and have crowned us with glory and honor. Help us to walk in a manner worthy of Your great name, giving You the reverence and praise that is due. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: To respect God's greatness, we must compare ourselves to a speck of dust to God's greatness. When we look at creation, we often feel small by comparison. To feel small is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell on our smallness. Humility means proper respect for God.
subject: Embrace God's Greatness, Your Smallness
verse_text: What is a man that You are mindful of Him, and the son of man that You visit him?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/4/2019:

_Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, _

_Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You. _

(Ps. 9:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God will never abandon those who seek Him.God's

promise does not mean that if we trust in Him we will

escape loss or suffering; it means that God Himself

will never leave us no matter what we face.

SO KEEP SEEKING. KEEP TRUST. KEEP ASKING. KEEP PRAYING.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God will never abandon those who seek Him. God's promise does not mean that if we trust in Him we will escape loss or suffering; it means that God Himself will never leave us no matter what we face. SO KEEP SEEKING. KEEP TRUST. KEEP ASKING. KEEP PRAYING.
original_verse_text: Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, knowing that You are a faithful God who will never abandon us. In the midst of life's trials and tribulations, we cling to Your promise that You will never leave us nor forsake us. Help us to continually seek You, to trust in Your unfailing love, and to boldly approach Your throne of grace, knowing that You are our refuge and strength. May our lives be a testament to Your unwavering presence and the hope we have in You. Amen.
reflection: God will never abandon those who seek Him. God's promise does not mean that if we trust in Him we will escape loss or suffering; it means that God Himself will never leave us no matter what we face. So keep seeking. Keep trusting. Keep asking. Keep praying.
subject: Unwavering Presence: God Never Abandons
verse_text: Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/5/2019:

_Bur You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted, You_

_consider their grief and take it in hand.The victims _

_commit themselves to You; You are the helper of the_

_ fatherless. _(Ps. 10:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Yes God is still on the throne. Evil men may think

they are getting away with murder, but we can be

assured that God's justice will prevail.

THE HARVEST OF JUDGMENT IS SURE AS SOON AS THE SEED

OF SIN IS SOWN.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Yes God is still on the throne. Evil men may think they are getting away with murder, but we can be assured that God's justice will prevail. THE HARVEST OF JUDGMENT IS SURE AS SOON AS THE SEED OF SIN IS SOWN.
original_verse_text: Bur You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted, You consider their grief and take it in hand. The victims commit themselves to You; You are the helper of the fatherless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that You are the righteous Judge who sees all and will not allow wickedness to go unpunished. Though evil men may seem to prosper for a time, we know that the harvest of judgment is certain for those who sow the seeds of sin. Help us to trust in Your perfect timing and unwavering justice, and to find our refuge in You alone. May Your will be done, and may Your name be glorified. Amen.
reflection: Yes, God is still on the throne. Evil men may think they are getting away with murder, but we can be assured that God's justice will prevail. The harvest of judgment is sure as soon as the seed of sin is sown.
subject: The Harvest of Judgment Assured
verse_text: Bur You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted, You consider their grief and take it in hand. The victims commit themselves to You; You are the helper of the fatherless.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/6/2019:

_O Lord, How long will You forget me? Forever?_

_How long will You look the other way? _(Ps. 13:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A spiritual slump can make us feel abandoned by God.

We may struggle with troubling thoughts. Our hearts

may become sorrowful like David, and become sure we

are fighting a losing battle. While in a slump we need to

plead with God, trust Him, and praise Him as David did.

TO TACKLE LIFE'S PROBLEMS, LETS REMEMBER TO TRUST GOD'S

PROMISES.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: A spiritual slump can make us feel abandoned by God. We may struggle with troubling thoughts. Our hearts may become sorrowful like David, and become sure we are fighting a losing battle. While in a slump we need to plead with God, trust Him, and praise Him as David did. TO TACKLE LIFE'S PROBLEMS, LETS REMEMBER TO TRUST GOD'S PROMISES.
original_verse_text: O Lord, How long will You forget me? Forever? How long will You look the other way?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of struggle and sorrow, when it feels as though You have forgotten us. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. Guide us in Your ways, that we may walk the path You have set before us. Even in the darkest of times, may we find comfort in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. We praise You, Lord, for Your steadfast presence in our lives. Amen.
reflection: A spiritual slump can make us feel abandoned by God. We may struggle with troubling thoughts. Our hearts may become sorrowful like David, and become sure we are fighting a losing battle. While in a slump, we need to plead with God, trust Him, and praise Him as David did. To tackle life's problems, let's remember to trust God's promises.
subject: Trusting God's Promises in Slumps
verse_text: O Lord, How long will You forget me? Forever? How long will You look the other way?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/7/2019:

_Who may worship in Your sanctuary, Lord?_

_Who may enter into Your presence on Your_

_Holy Hill? _(Ps. 15:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God calls His people to be morally upright, and, in the five

verses of this Psalm He gives us 10 standards.I suggest that

you read them. If you have read them, do you have the kind

of rock-solid integrity that can stand the test of living honestly

day by day?

DAVID SAID THAT IF WE DO, WE WILL "NEVER BE SHAKEN." (15:5)
original_reflection_text: God calls His people to be morally upright, and, in the five verses of this Psalm He gives us 10 standards. I suggest that you read them. If you have read them, do you have the kind of rock-solid integrity that can stand the test of living honestly day by day? DAVID SAID THAT IF WE DO, WE WILL "NEVER BE SHAKEN. " (15:5)
original_verse_text: Who may worship in Your sanctuary, Lord? Who may enter into Your presence on Your Holy Hill?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to walk in integrity and uprightness, as Your Word instructs. Grant us the strength to live with blameless hearts, speaking the truth and doing what is right in Your sight. May our lives be a testimony to Your faithfulness, that we may never be shaken, but stand firm in our devotion to You. Guide us, Lord, that we may dwell in Your presence and inherit the eternal blessings You have promised. Amen.
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright, and in the five verses of this psalm, He gives us 10 standards. I suggest that you read them. If you have read them, do you have the kind of rock-solid integrity that can stand the test of living honestly day by day? David said that if we do, we will "never be shaken." (15:5)
subject: Unshakable Integrity: God's Standards
verse_text: Who may worship in Your sanctuary, Lord? Who may enter into Your presence on Your Holy Hill?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/8/2019:

_My heart is filled with joy, and my mouth shouts His praise!_

_My body rest in safety. _(Ps. 16:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

True joy is far deeper than happiness; we can feel joy, in spite of

our deepest troubles. Happiness is temporary because it is based on

external circumstances, but joy is lasting because it is based on
God's

presence, within us. As we contemplate His daily presence, we will

find contentment.

DON'T BASE YOUR LIFE ON CIRCUMSTANCES, BUT ON GOD!
original_reflection_text: True joy is far deeper than happiness; we can feel joy, in spite of our deepest troubles. Happiness is temporary because it is based on external circumstances, but joy is lasting because it is based on God's presence, within us. As we contemplate His daily presence, we will find contentment. DON'T BASE YOUR LIFE ON CIRCUMSTANCES, BUT ON GOD!
original_verse_text: My heart is filled with joy, and my mouth shouts His praise! My body rest in safety.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, rejoicing in Your constant presence and the joy that transcends our circumstances. Help us to find our contentment not in the fleeting pleasures of this world, but in the abiding peace that comes from knowing You. May our hearts and minds be guarded by Your Spirit, that we may experience the fullness of Your joy, even in the midst of our trials. We trust in Your unfailing love and faithfulness, for You are the source of our strength and our salvation. Amen.
reflection: True joy is far deeper than happiness; we can feel joy, in spite of our deepest troubles. Happiness is temporary because it is based on external circumstances, but joy is lasting because it is based on God's presence, within us. As we contemplate His daily presence, we will find contentment. Don't base your life on circumstances, but on God!
subject: Lasting Joy Amid Troubles
verse_text: My heart is filled with joy, and my mouth shouts His praise! My body rest in safety.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/9/2019:

_In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my _

_God for help. From His temple He heard my voice; _

_my cry came before Him, into His ears. _(Ps. 18:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Surely God puts people into our lives to give us help

and comfort. But let's also remember to pray.God will

hear us. David sang "From His temple he heard my

voice; my cry came before, into His ears." Our faith

should be like David's "He is our rock, our fortress,

and our deliver,"

PRAYER IS THE BRIDGE BETWEEN PANIC AND PEACE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Surely God puts people into our lives to give us help and comfort. But let's also remember to pray. God will hear us. David sang "From His temple he heard my voice; my cry came before, into His ears. " Our faith should be like David's "He is our rock, our fortress, and our deliver, " PRAYER IS THE BRIDGE BETWEEN PANIC AND PEACE.
original_verse_text: In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my God for help. From His temple He heard my voice; my cry came before Him, into His ears.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of need, knowing that You hear our cries and are ever-present to deliver us. Like David, we find refuge in You, our rock and fortress, the one who rescues us. When panic threatens to overwhelm us, let our prayers be the bridge that leads us to Your peace. May we ever trust in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: Surely God puts people into our lives to give us help and comfort. But let's also remember to pray. God will hear us. David sang "From His temple he heard my voice; my cry came before, into His ears." Our faith should be like David's "He is our rock, our fortress, and our deliverer." Prayer is the bridge between panic and peace.
subject: Panic to Peace Through Prayer
verse_text: In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my God for help. From His temple He heard my voice; my cry came before Him, into His ears.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/10/2019:

_The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim _

_the work of His hands. _(Ps. 19:1)

THE THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Yes we have remarkable evidence of God's design throughout

creation, telling us of a God of order,design, and greatness.Now

what is even more amazing is the fact that God has taken personal

interest in us. Yes God cared so much that He sent His own Son to

die for us. This great Creator became our Savior.

ALL CREATION IS AN OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Yes we have remarkable evidence of God's design throughout creation, telling us of a God of order, design, and greatness. Now what is even more amazing is the fact that God has taken personal interest in us. Yes God cared so much that He sent His own Son to die for us. This great Creator became our Savior. ALL CREATION IS AN OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD.
original_verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of His hands.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your magnificent creation, which displays the glory and power of Your divine hand. Yet, we are humbled to know that You, the Creator of all, have shown us the depth of Your love by sending Your Son, Jesus, to die for us. May the wonders of nature continually point us to Your greatness, and may the sacrifice of Christ on our behalf compel us to live in grateful devotion to You. Amen.
reflection: Yes, we have remarkable evidence of God's design throughout creation, telling us of a God of order, design, and greatness. Now, what is even more amazing is the fact that God has taken a personal interest in us. Yes, God cared so much that He sent His own Son to die for us. This great Creator became our Savior. ALL CREATION IS AN OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD.
subject: The Creator's Loving Embrace
verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of His hands.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/11/2019;

_Some trust is chariots and some in horses, but we _

_trust in the name of the Lord our God. _(Ps. 20: 7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

David knew, that the true might of his nation WAS NOT

in weaponry but in worship, not in firepower, but in

God's power. Because God alone can preserve a nation

or an individual, be sure your confidence is in God alone,

who gives eternal victory.

IN A WORLD OF CHANGES, WE NEED TO TRUST OUR UNCHANGING GOD.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: David knew, that the true might of his nation WAS NOT in weaponry but in worship, not in firepower, but in God's power. Because God alone can preserve a nation or an individual, be sure your confidence is in God alone, who gives eternal victory. IN A WORLD OF CHANGES, WE NEED TO TRUST OUR UNCHANGING GOD.
original_verse_text: 19; Some trust is chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our true strength and security lie not in the fleeting things of this world, but in Your eternal power and unfailing love. Help us, like David, to place our trust not in chariots or horses, but in Your name, the Lord our God. Guide us, we pray, that we may walk in Your ways and lean not on our own understanding, but in all our ways submit to You, that You may make our paths straight. For in You alone do we find the victory that lasts forever. Amen.
reflection: David knew that the true might of his nation was not in weaponry but in worship, not in firepower, but in God's power. Because God alone can preserve a nation or an individual, be sure your confidence is in God alone, who gives eternal victory. In a world of changes, we need to trust our unchanging God.
subject: Confidence in God's Unchanging Power
verse_text: 19; Some trust is chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/12/2019:

_Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you_

_your heart's desire. _(Ps. 37:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It's natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like

to be or what we'd like to have. But we must evaluate our

desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says

will truly satisfy. When our desires conform to God's will,

we're not likely to waste our time wishing for things that

can't satisfy. Real joy comes from wanting to be close to God.

REAL CONTENTMENT COMES WHEN WE REALIZE GOD HAS EVERYTHING

WE NEED.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: It's natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like to be or what we'd like to have. But we must evaluate our desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says will truly satisfy. When our desires conform to God's will, we're not likely to waste our time wishing for things that can't satisfy. Real joy comes from wanting to be close to God. REAL CONTENTMENT COMES WHEN WE REALIZE GOD HAS EVERYTHING WE NEED.
original_verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you your heart's desire.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true delight comes not from the things of this world, but from delighting in You. Help us to align our desires with Your perfect will, that we may find our deepest satisfaction in drawing near to You. Grant us the contentment and strength to be content in all circumstances, trusting that You alone can provide for our every need. May our lives reflect the joy and peace that comes from resting in Your sovereign care. Amen.
reflection: It's natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like to be or what we'd like to have. But we must evaluate our desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says will truly satisfy. When our desires conform to God's will, we're not likely to waste our time wishing for things that can't satisfy. Real joy comes from wanting to be close to God. Real contentment comes when we realize God has everything we need.
subject: Discover True Contentment in God
verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you your heart's desire.

original_content:
THE VERSE FOR 2/13/2019:

_The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing. _(Ps. 23:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you are a worrier, there is hope for you! When you

think about a problem over and over in your mind, that's

called worry. When you think about God's Word over

and over in your mind, that's_ meditation_. If you know how

to worry, you already know how to meditate! The more we

meditate on God's Word the less we need to worry.

GOD USES THOSE WHO CAN HONESTLY SAY, "THE LORD IS

MY SHEPHERD."

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: If you are a worrier, there is hope for you! When you think about a problem over and over in your mind, that's called worry. When you think about God's Word over and over in your mind, that's meditation. If you know how to worry, you already know how to meditate! The more we meditate on God's Word the less we need to worry. GOD USES THOSE WHO CAN HONESTLY SAY, "THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD. "
original_verse_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are our Shepherd who provides for all our needs. In times of worry and anxiety, help us to turn our thoughts to Your Word and meditate on Your promises of peace and protection. May we find rest in the truth that You are in control, and that we can cast all our cares upon You. Guide us to replace our worries with the assurance of Your steadfast love. We trust in Your perfect care. Amen.
reflection: If you are a worrier, there is hope for you! When you think about a problem over and over in your mind, that's called worry. When you think about God's Word over and over in your mind, that's meditation. If you know how to worry, you already know how to meditate! The more we meditate on God's Word, the less we need to worry. God uses those who can honestly say, "The Lord is my shepherd."
subject: Worry Not, Meditate on God
verse_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/14/2019:

_Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow_

_of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me, Your _

_rod and Your staff, they comfort me._ (Ps. 23:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live.

But Ps. 23 gives five reasons why follower of God don't need

to fear. Here are the reasons: God is right beside us (v. 4) He

will comfort you (v. 4) He provides for you in spite of your

enemies (v. 5) He makes goodness and mercy follow you (v.6.)

He will receive you at death into His house (v. 6).

ASK GOD TO REPLACE ANY FEAR YOU MAY HAVE WITH THE CONFIDENCE

HE ALONE CAN GIVE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live. But Psalm 23 gives five reasons why follower of God don't need to fear. Here are the reasons: God is right beside us (v. 4) He will comfort you (v. 4) He provides for you in spite of your enemies (v. 5) He makes goodness and mercy follow you (v. 6. ) He will receive you at death into His house (v. 6). ASK GOD TO REPLACE ANY FEAR YOU MAY HAVE WITH THE CONFIDENCE HE ALONE CAN GIVE.
original_verse_text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me, Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are our Shepherd who leads us beside still waters and restores our souls (Psalm 23:1-3). Though we may walk through the valley of the shadow of death, we need not fear, for You are with us (Psalm 23:4). Fill us with Your comforting presence and the confidence that Your goodness and mercy will follow us all the days of our lives (Psalm 23:6). May our fear be replaced by the unshakable trust that we will dwell in Your house forever. Amen.
reflection: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live. But Psalm 23 gives five reasons why follower of God don't need to fear. Here are the reasons: God is right beside us (v. 4) He will comfort you (v. 4) He provides for you in spite of your enemies (v. 5) He makes goodness and mercy follow you (v. 6. ) He will receive you at death into His house (v. 6). ASK GOD TO REPLACE ANY FEAR YOU MAY HAVE WITH THE CONFIDENCE HE ALONE CAN GIVE.
subject: Overcome Fear with God's Presence
verse_text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me, Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/15/2019:

_The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His_

_ people with peace. _(Ps. 29:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God gives us strength for those times when we are weak and

fearful. He provides it for each day and for every difficulty.

God also gives peace to guard the door of our heart in the midst

of trials. Are you facing some emotional crises? Turn it over to

God. You'll have many trying days, but He will give you the

strength to go on and the peace to comfort your soul. Claim the

double promise of (Psalm 29:11) as your own.

THE SECRET OF PEACE IS TO GIVE ALL YOUR ANXIETIES TO GOD.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: God gives us strength for those times when we are weak and fearful. He provides it for each day and for every difficulty. God also gives peace to guard the door of our heart in the midst of trials. Are you facing some emotional crises? Turn it over to God. You'll have many trying days, but He will give you the strength to go on and the peace to comfort your soul. Claim the double promise of (Psalm 29:11) as your own. THE SECRET OF PEACE IS TO GIVE ALL YOUR ANXIETIES TO GOD.
original_verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His people with peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of weakness and fear, knowing that You alone can provide the strength we need for each day and every difficulty. Lord, we give You our anxieties and emotional crises, trusting that You will grant us the peace to guard our hearts, even in the midst of trials. May we cling to the promise of Psalm 29:11, that You will give us the strength and peace we so desperately need. We surrender all to You, our gracious and loving God. Amen.
reflection: God gives us strength for those times when we are weak and fearful. He provides it for each day and for every difficulty. God also gives peace to guard the door of our heart in the midst of trials. Are you facing some emotional crises? Turn it over to God. You'll have many trying days, but He will give you the strength to go on and the peace to comfort your soul. Claim the double promise of (Psalm 29:11) as your own. The secret of peace is to give all your anxieties to God.
subject: Strength and Peace for Trials
verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His people with peace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR2/17/2019:

_God's anger lasts for a moment, but his favor lasts a_

_lifetime; weeping may go on for a night, but rejoicing_

_comes in the morning._ (Ps. 30:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Like the discomfort of the shots the nurse gave me before the

doctor began to remove my cancer, the discomfort of God 's

anger is just for a moment, but the good effects go on for a long

time. Let God's anger be a sharp pain that warns you to turn

from sin..

WHEN WE ARE CALLED HOME TO HEAVEN, BY GOD'S GRACE WE WILL

BE READY TO GO.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Like the discomfort of the shots the nurse gave me before the doctor began to remove my cancer, the discomfort of God 's anger is just for a moment, but the good effects go on for a long time. Let God's anger be a sharp pain that warns you to turn from sin. WHEN WE ARE CALLED HOME TO HEAVEN, BY GOD'S GRACE WE WILL BE READY TO GO.
original_verse_text: God's anger lasts for a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime; weeping may go on for a night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that Your anger is but for a moment, and Your favor lasts a lifetime. Though the pain of conviction may be sharp, we know it is a merciful warning to turn from sin and walk in Your ways. As we face the trials of this life, may we ever be mindful that our true home is with You in heaven, where we will one day dwell in Your presence forever. In Your grace, may we be found ready when You call us home. Amen.
reflection: Like the discomfort of the shots the nurse gave me before the doctor began to remove my cancer, the discomfort of God's anger is just for a moment, but the good effects go on for a long time. Let God's anger be a sharp pain that warns you to turn from sin. When we are called home to heaven, by God's grace we will be ready to go.
subject: Discomfort Precedes Lasting Good
verse_text: God's anger lasts for a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime; weeping may go on for a night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/18/2019:

_I entrust my spirit into Your hand. Rescue me, Lord, for_

_You are a faithful God. _(Ps. 31:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We say we have faith in God, but do we truly trust Him?

We need to convey our complete trust in God. We should

commit our possessions, our families and our vocations to

God.

BUT FIRST AND FOREMOST, WE SHOULD COMMIT OURSELVES COMPLETELY

TO HIM.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: We say we have faith in God, but do we truly trust Him? We need to convey our complete trust in God. We should commit our possessions, our families and our vocations to God. BUT FIRST AND FOREMOST, WE SHOULD COMMIT OURSELVES COMPLETELY TO HIM.
original_verse_text: I entrust my spirit into Your hand. Rescue me, Lord, for You are a faithful God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts full of gratitude, acknowledging that our trust should be in You alone. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to commit our ways to You, trusting that You will direct our paths. May we surrender ourselves completely to Your will, knowing that our lives are secure in Your loving hands. We place our spirits into Your care, for You are the faithful God who will guide us. Amen.
reflection: We say we have faith in God, but do we truly trust Him? We need to convey our complete trust in God. We should commit our possessions, our families, and our vocations to God. But first and foremost, we should commit ourselves completely to Him.
subject: Commit Yourself Completely to God
verse_text: I entrust my spirit into Your hand. Rescue me, Lord, for You are a faithful God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/19/2019:

_I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should_

_go; I will counsel you with My loving eye on you. _(Ps. 32:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We all face problems that can threaten to confuse and disorient

us. It may be a call from the doctor's office, a friend who has
betrayed

you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be especially
careful.

When you are blinded by life's disappointments don't trust your own

instincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide you.

GOD PROMISES, "I WILL INSTRUCT YOU AND TEACH YOU IN THE WAY YOU

SHOULD GO" (Psalm 32:8)

_PASTOR AL._
original_reflection_text: We all face problems that can threaten to confuse and disorient us. It may be a call from the doctor's office, a friend who has betrayed you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be especially careful. When you are blinded by life's disappointments don't trust your own instincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide you. GOD PROMISES, "I WILL INSTRUCT YOU AND TEACH YOU IN THE WAY YOU SHOULD GO" (Psalm 32:8)
original_verse_text: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My loving eye on you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in times of confusion and uncertainty, when the challenges of life threaten to overwhelm us. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, and not rely on our own understanding. Guide us in Your ways, for You have promised to instruct and teach us the path we should take. May we walk in Your light, secure in the knowledge that You are leading us. Amen.
reflection: We all face problems that can threaten to confuse and disorient us. It may be a call from the doctor's office, a friend who has betrayed you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be especially careful. When you are blinded by life's disappointments, don't trust your own instincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide you. God promises, "I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go" (Psalm 32:8).
subject: Seek God's Guidance in Trials
verse_text: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My loving eye on you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/20/2019:

_Sing to the Lord, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright _

_to praise Him. Sing to Him a new song. _(Ps. 33:1, 3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Why should we sing? Is it only to prepare worshipers for the

sermon? Let us never say this is a gimmick! The writer of

Psalm 33 called upon the worshiping Israelites to sing praises

to God for His powerful Word, His unfailing counsels, and

His continual concern for His people.

REMEMBER THE LORD IS PLEASED WITH ANY MELODY OF PRAISE

THAT COMES FROM THE HEART.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Why should we sing? Is it only to prepare worshipers for the sermon? Let us never say this is a gimmick! The writer of Psalm 33 called upon the worshiping Israelites to sing praises to God for His powerful Word, His unfailing counsels, and His continual concern for His people. REMEMBER THE LORD IS PLEASED WITH ANY MELODY OF PRAISE THAT COMES FROM THE HEART.
original_verse_text: Sing to the Lord, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright to praise Him. Sing to Him a new song.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts full of gratitude and voices lifted in joyful praise. Your Word is a lamp to our feet and a light to our path, guiding us with Your unfailing counsel. May the melodies we sing be a sweet offering, reflecting the deep wells of thankfulness within us. We give thanks to You, O Lord, for Your constant care and unwavering love. May our songs of worship be a pleasing sound in Your ears, a testament to the joy we find in You. Amen.
reflection: Why should we sing? Is it only to prepare worshipers for the sermon? Let us never say this is a gimmick! The writer of Psalm 33 called upon the worshiping Israelites to sing praises to God for His powerful Word, His unfailing counsel, and His continual concern for His people. Remember the Lord is pleased with any melody of praise that comes from the heart.
subject: Sing Praises to the Lord
verse_text: Sing to the Lord, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright to praise Him. Sing to Him a new song.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/21.2019:

_Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight_

_against those who fight against me. _(Ps. 35:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Have you found yourself in an environment that is not

friendly to godliness? If so what can you do? here are

some suggestions: Concentrate on God's goodness and

depend on it. Stay true to your conviction. (Dan. 1)

Immerse yourself in the Bible. ((Ps. 119: 49-50)

Return good for evil. (Mt. 5:44)

Trust God to be your companion (Heb. 13:5)

WHEN IT'S JUST YOU AND GOD, THAT'S ENOUGH.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Have you found yourself in an environment that is not friendly to godliness? If so what can you do? here are some suggestions: Concentrate on God's goodness and depend on it. Stay true to your conviction. (Daniel 1) Immerse yourself in the Bible. ((Psalm 119:49-50) Return good for evil. (Matthew 5:44) Trust God to be your companion (Hebrews 13:5) WHEN IT'S JUST YOU AND GOD, THAT'S ENOUGH.
original_verse_text: Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in times of adversity, when the world around us seems to oppose Your ways. Help us to trust in Your goodness and depend on Your guidance, as Daniel did. May we immerse ourselves in Your Word, finding strength and comfort in Your promises. Give us the courage to return good for evil, and to remember that when it is just us and You, that is more than enough. We place our lives in Your hands, Lord. Amen.
reflection: Have you found yourself in an environment that is not friendly to godliness? If so, what can you do? Here are some suggestions: Concentrate on God's goodness and depend on it. Stay true to your convictions. (Daniel 1) Immerse yourself in the Bible. (Psalm 119:49-50) Return good for evil. (Matthew 5:44) Trust God to be your companion. (Hebrews 13:5) When it's just you and God, that's enough.
subject: Thrive in Ungodly Environments
verse_text: Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/22/2019:

_They feast on the abundance of Your house; You give_

_them drink from Your river of delights. _(Ps. 36:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Psalm 36 we read about God's loving kindness. It

describes those who put their trust in Him and are

abundantly satisfied. God gives them water from His

"river of delights" (vs. 8). We can go to God every day

for the supply of our needs. Let us be filled with His

abundant supply. His fountain will never run dry.

GOD'S LOVE IS ABUNDANT.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In Psalm 36 we read about God's loving kindness. It describes those who put their trust in Him and are abundantly satisfied. God gives them water from His "river of delights" (vs. 8). We can go to God every day for the supply of our needs. Let us be filled with His abundant supply. His fountain will never run dry. GOD'S LOVE IS ABUNDANT.
original_verse_text: They feast on the abundance of Your house; You give them drink from Your river of delights.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your loving-kindness is abundant and Your faithfulness reaches to the heavens. You are the fountain of life, and in Your light, we see light. Lord, we long to be satisfied with the rich feast of Your presence, to drink deeply from the river of Your delights. Fill us with Your overflowing love, that we may find our true joy and sustenance in You alone. May we ever trust in the shelter of Your wings, resting securely in the shadow of Your love. Amen.
reflection: In Psalm 36, we read about God's loving kindness. It describes those who put their trust in Him and are abundantly satisfied. God gives them water from His "river of delights" (v. 8). We can go to God every day for the supply of our needs. Let us be filled with His abundant supply. His fountain will never run dry. God's love is abundant.
subject: God's Abundant Love Satisfies
verse_text: They feast on the abundance of Your house; You give them drink from Your river of delights.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/23/2019:

_Be still in the presence of the Lord, and wait patiently_

_for Him to act. Don't worry about evil people who_

_prosper or fret about their wicked schemes. _(Ps. 37:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Ps. 37, God is saying, in effect, "Do what's right and

trust Me, regardless of how badly you may seem to be

losing, do my will and leave the outcome to me." Such

a strategy will not only keep us from beating ourselves

but it will also lead to victory!

GOD'S CLOCK IS NEVER SLOW, BUT SOMETIMES OURS IS FAST.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In Psalm 37, God is saying, in effect, "Do what's right and trust Me, regardless of how badly you may seem to be losing, do my will and leave the outcome to me. " Such a strategy will not only keep us from beating ourselves but it will also lead to victory! GOD'S CLOCK IS NEVER SLOW, BUT SOMETIMES OURS IS FAST.
original_verse_text: Be still in the presence of the Lord, and wait patiently for Him to act. Don't worry about evil people who prosper or fret about their wicked schemes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with hearts that long to trust in Your perfect plan, even when the path ahead seems unclear. Help us to resist the temptation to rely on our own understanding, and instead, commit our ways to You. May we find peace in the knowledge that Your timing is always right, and that as we do what is pleasing in Your sight, You will make our paths straight. We surrender our anxious thoughts to You, Lord, and choose to rest in Your sovereign will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In Psalm 37, God is saying, in effect, "Do what's right and trust Me, regardless of how badly you may seem to be losing. Do my will and leave the outcome to me." Such a strategy will not only keep us from beating ourselves, but it will also lead to victory! God's clock is never slow, but sometimes ours is fast.
subject: Doing Right, Trusting God
verse_text: Be still in the presence of the Lord, and wait patiently for Him to act. Don't worry about evil people who prosper or fret about their wicked schemes.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/24/2019:

_Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God._

(Ps. 38:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The answer for any of our destructive foolishness is to call

upon the wisdom of God. (Pro. 9:10) reminds us, that _"the _

_fear of the Lord is the begging of wisdom,AND KNOWLEDGE _

_of the Holy One is understanding. Only by allowing God to _

transform us can we overcome the foolish decisions that cause

so much trouble.

WITH HIS LOVING GUIDANCE, WE CAN FOLLOW THE PATHWAY OF

GODLY WISDOM.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The answer for any of our destructive foolishness is to call upon the wisdom of God. (Proverbs 9:10) reminds us, that "the fear of the Lord is the begging of wisdom, AND KNOWLEDGE of the Holy One is understanding. Only by allowing God to transform us can we overcome the foolish decisions that cause so much trouble. WITH HIS LOVING GUIDANCE, WE CAN FOLLOW THE PATHWAY OF GODLY WISDOM.
original_verse_text: Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our need for Your divine wisdom and understanding. Your Word reminds us that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One brings true insight. Lord, we confess our tendency towards foolish decisions that lead us astray. Transform our hearts, that we may walk the pathway of godly wisdom, guided by Your loving hand. Grant us the strength to wait patiently for You, as the Psalmist did, trusting in Your perfect timing and plan. May we ever seek to honor You in all our ways. Amen.
reflection: The answer for any of our destructive foolishness is to call upon the wisdom of God. (Proverbs 9:10) reminds us that "the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding. Only by allowing God to transform us can we overcome the foolish decisions that cause so much trouble. With His loving guidance, we can follow the pathway of godly wisdom.
subject: Wisdom Overcomes Destructive Foolishness
verse_text: Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/25/2019:

_Blessed is he who considers the poor, the Lord will deliver him_

_in time of trouble_. (Psalm 41:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Hebrew word translated considers means, "to take thought

of others." The word translated poor means, " those in need,"

there are many around us who are poor--poor in love, poor in

hope, or poor in the knowledge of God. Even though we cannot

solve all their problems-BUT WE CAN SHOW THEM WE CARE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The Hebrew word translated considers means, "to take thought of others. " The word translated poor means, " those in need, " there are many around us who are poor--poor in love, poor in hope, or poor in the knowledge of God. Even though we cannot solve all their problems-BUT WE CAN SHOW THEM WE CARE.
original_verse_text: Blessed is he who considers the poor, the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing that You have called us to consider the needs of the poor and vulnerable around us. Help us to open our eyes and our hands to those who are poor in love, hope, or the knowledge of You. May we not merely pity them, but actively seek to show them Your care and compassion. Give us wisdom and discernment to know how best to serve and minister to those in need. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: The Hebrew word translated "considers" means "to take thought of others." The word translated "poor" means "those in need." There are many around us who are poorpoor in love, poor in hope, or poor in the knowledge of God. Even though we cannot solve all their problems, we can show them we care.
subject: Caring for the Poor
verse_text: Blessed is he who considers the poor, the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/26/2019:

_My heat is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses_

_for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skilled writer._ (Ps. 45:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Are you sometimes discouraged, thinking you have little

to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and

a willing tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly

to God today and begin bringing praise and honor to the lord.

LET IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT!

_PASTO AL_
original_reflection_text: Are you sometimes discouraged, thinking you have little to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and a willing tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly to God today and begin bringing praise and honor to the lord. LET IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT!
original_verse_text: My heat is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skilled writer.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that we are Your workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works (Ephesians 2:10). Though we may feel inadequate, we know that our words, when guided by Your Spirit, can bring praise and honor to Your name (Psalm 45:1). Lord, fill us with the confidence to offer our lives as living sacrifices, that through us, Your love may be proclaimed to the world. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Are you sometimes discouraged, thinking you have little to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and a willing tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly to God today and begin bringing praise and honor to the Lord. LET IT BE MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT!
subject: Offer What You Have to God
verse_text: My heat is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skilled writer.

original_content:
VERSE FOR2/27/2019:

_The lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold_

_in times of trouble. _(Ps. 9:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about

God's goodness. Is God always good? Yes, He is! He

doesn't promise that bad things will never happen to us,

but He does promise to be "our refuge and strength."

(Ps. 46:1) GOD IS GOOD--no matter what suffering we

are experiencing.

GOD TESTS OUR FAITH SO WE MAY TRUST HIS FAITHFULNESS.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about God's goodness. Is God always good? Yes, He is! He doesn't promise that bad things will never happen to us, but He does promise to be "our refuge and strength. " (Psalm 46:1) GOD IS GOOD--no matter what suffering we are experiencing. GOD TESTS OUR FAITH SO WE MAY TRUST HIS FAITHFULNESS.
original_verse_text: The lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of our trials and tribulations, seeking refuge and strength. When the waves of adversity threaten to overwhelm us, we cling to the truth that You are our ever-present help in times of trouble. Lord, help us to trust in Your goodness, even when we cannot understand the reasons for our suffering. May our faith be strengthened as we experience Your faithfulness, for You are a mighty fortress, a sure foundation in the face of life's storms. We praise You, our gracious and loving God. Amen.
reflection: When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about God's goodness. Is God always good? Yes, He is! He doesn't promise that bad things will never happen to us, but He does promise to be "our refuge and strength." (Psalm 46:1) God is goodno matter what suffering we are experiencing. God tests our faith so we may trust His faithfulness.
subject: God's Goodness in Suffering
verse_text: The lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/28/2019:

_For God is the king of all the earth; sing to Him_

_a psalm of praise. _(Ps. 47:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing

in church. I'm not talking about the quality of our

voices, but the honesty of our words.

'Just as I am" "Just as I pretend to be."

"O How I Love Jesus" becomes "O How I like Jesus'

"I Surrender All" is actually "I Surrender Some"

"He's Everything to Me" means "He's Quiet a Bit To Me"

TO SING GOD'S PRAISES LET US KEEP OUR HEARTS IN TUNE WITH HIM.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing in church. I'm not talking about the quality of our voices, but the honesty of our words. 'Just as I am" "Just as I pretend to be. " "O How I Love Jesus" becomes "O How I like Jesus' "I Surrender All" is actually "I Surrender Some" "He's Everything to Me" means "He's Quiet a Bit To Me" TO SING GOD'S PRAISES LET US KEEP OUR HEARTS IN TUNE WITH HIM.
original_verse_text: For God is the king of all the earth; sing to Him a psalm of praise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts longing to sing Your praises with sincerity and truth. Forgive us for the times when our words do not match the state of our souls. May our lips be opened to declare Your glory, and may our lives be in tune with the melody of Your will. Help us to surrender all to You, the One who is everything to us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing in church. I'm not talking about the quality of our voices, but the honesty of our words. "Just as I am," "Just as I pretend to be." "O How I Love Jesus" becomes "O How I like Jesus." "I Surrender All" is actually "I Surrender Some." "He's Everything to Me" means "He's Quite a Bit to Me." To sing God's praises, let us keep our hearts in tune with Him.
subject: Honest Worship Pleases God
verse_text: For God is the king of all the earth; sing to Him a psalm of praise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/1/2019

_Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord Almighty; the whole _

_earth is full __of His glory. _(Isa. 6:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Since the Lord is holy, all His attributes share in that perfection.

Let me explain what this means. as a holy God , He is perfect in

righteousness, justice, truthfulness, and faithfulness.

_HIS PERFECT RIGHTEOUSNESS, _assures us that we can trust His will

because He'll always do what is right.

_HIS PERFECT JUSTICE, M_eans that God will be unquestionably fair.

_HIS PERFECT TRUTHFULNESS, _assures us that we can take Him at His
word.

_HIS PERFECT FAITHFULNESS, _tells us that He will never let us down.

WE CAN HAVE ABSOLUTE CONFIDENCE IN OUR RIGHTEOUS, JUST, TRUTHFUL,

AND FAITHFUL GOD BECAUSE HE IS HOLY.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Since the Lord is holy, all His attributes share in that perfection. Let me explain what this means. as a holy God, He is perfect in righteousness, justice, truthfulness, and faithfulness. HIS PERFECT RIGHTEOUSNESS, assures us that we can trust His will because He'll always do what is right. HIS PERFECT JUSTICE, Means that God will be unquestionably fair. HIS PERFECT TRUTHFULNESS, assures us that we can take Him at His word. HIS PERFECT FAITHFULNESS, tells us that He will never let us down. WE CAN HAVE ABSOLUTE CONFIDENCE IN OUR RIGHTEOUS, JUST, TRUTHFUL, AND FAITHFUL GOD BECAUSE HE IS HOLY.
original_verse_text: Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth is full of His glory.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise Your holy name, for You are righteous, just, truthful, and faithful. Your perfection is beyond our understanding, yet we can trust in Your will and have confidence in Your promises. May we ever revere Your holiness and submit to Your sovereign rule. We bow before You, the thrice-holy Lord, and give You all glory and honor. Amen.
reflection: Since the Lord is holy, all His attributes share in that perfection. Let me explain what this means. As a holy God, He is perfect in righteousness, justice, truthfulness, and faithfulness. His perfect righteousness assures us that we can trust His will because He'll always do what is right. His perfect justice means that God will be unquestionably fair. His perfect truthfulness assures us that we can take Him at His word. His perfect faithfulness tells us that He will never let us down. We can have absolute confidence in our righteous, just, truthful, and faithful God because He is holy.
subject: The Holy God's Perfection
verse_text: Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth is full of His glory.
